alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:32PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Floyd and southeastern Briscoe Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Quitaque, or 7 miles southwest of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caprock Canyon State Park and Quitaque. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
